website_summaries.verdict: Large quantity, sturdy, spacious  construction, and an affordable price makes these bags an excellent value.
pros: An excellent deal, as you get 900 quality bags (60 rolls with 15 bags each) that are a bit longer than some competitors
Bags fit most other types of bag dispensers
cons: Bags are a bit difficult to separate from the roll and open to use

website_summaries.verdict: They are affordable and the material feels strong, but there are also some reported issues that make them less user-friendly than some competitors.
pros: Practical and strong – offers ample 13" length and leak-proof material
Comes with a bonus bag dispenser that has a secure leash clip
cons: Somewhat difficult to tear from the roll and open
Some users reported finding a few bags sealed at both ends

customer_reviews.title: They are bags for crap - we don't need them to cure cancer!!
customer_reviews.text: The bags DO fit in the dispenser - I have no idea why people are saying that. The dispenser is also just a freebie - I couldn't care less if the thing breaks. The bags are 12.5" x 8.5". All I know is that PetSmart charges $20 for 240 bags ($.08/ea) You can get similar bags from Ross/Marshalls for $5 ($.02/ea) I bought 900 bags for about 1 cent each....I can use 7 bags every time my dog poops and still be getting a better deal than PetSmart.
customer_reviews.author: Heather m

customer_reviews.title: Defective perforations. Don't tear loose
customer_reviews.text: Discovered after going through the first couple rolls that the remainder of the box didn't have adequate perforations to simply tear off a bag from the enclosed holder. Not even close. We are now unrolling them while sitting and putting a foot on one end and pulling violently to tear the bag loose. Then stack them and put them in a pocket. Of course by the time we got to the defective ones it was too late to return them. So yes, they pick up dog poop but only after you have wrenched them free from the roll by using your foot and biceps.
customer_reviews.author: Jackieb

customer_reviews.title: 5 STAR DOG POOP EXPERIENCE
customer_reviews.text: I never knew picking up dog poop could be such an amazing time. As soon as I took one of the black plastic bags from the wonderful included clip, rainbows exploded from my dog and it was basically Mardi Gras in the dog park. PROS: +Bags are black +Bags arent transparent, so I cant see the mess +Rainbows +Included dispenser is an excellent value PS, I LOVE THE ARROWS POINTING TO THE OPENING!!!!! No longer do I look like an idiot trying to open the bag from the wrong end while my dog gives me that WTF look. Thank you AmazonBasics!
customer_reviews.author: Craig

customer_reviews.title: Each bag shredded at the seams when pulled out of dispenser!
customer_reviews.text: I received these in the mail yesterday and I was very excited to have such a great deal. However, the first time my husband took the dog on a walk he tried to use the bags, and one out of six did not rip. At first I though he was being to hard on them when he pulled them out of the container, so I tried and sure enough, the bags shredded at the seams! One out of six did not rip. I am attaching a picture, but the bags are shredded. Will be returning. Sorry to the people who still have dog poop in their yard😩 Even our dog is not amused by this problem haha
customer_reviews.author: Sue

customer_reviews.title: Weak perforations between bags - a struggle to separate !!
customer_reviews.text: These bags must be defective as the perforations to separate them is very weak. Literally a struggle on a daily basis. We used up a roll, otherwise would have returned it back to Amazon. Not sure if anyone else has experienced this issue. First time ordering this product. Bags themselves are sturdy - but not easy to tear without a struggle.
customer_reviews.author: AG

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY  FULL OF WORMS!!!!
customer_reviews.text: The bags work like you'd expect. They are smaller. If you have a 100 pound dog take 2. But the nastiest thing was that about half the rolls had these weird green worms in them. When the box arrived it was taped all over. Every seem was covered in at least one piece of tape--as if the seller knew bugs/worms were getting in. They got in anyway. We're still using these bags but I would never order these again. Disgusting!!
customer_reviews.author: Dutton and Beth Armstrong, Editors

customer_reviews.title: Quality decreased :/
customer_reviews.text: Scent isn’t over whelming. The durability of the bags has been compromised. We have been using these bags for a couple years now and the latest order proved to be different. As soon as we refilled our dispenser, we noticed the bags are just not as thick. These were always a cut above the rest for the best price. Now, they appear to have the same quality as seen in dozens of other companies. Going to need to price check going forward if the product is now the same.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: Not Bio-Degradable. Extremely hard to open. Irresponsible Purchase.
customer_reviews.text: I bought these bags because they were cheap, and I am cheap. The issue with these bags is that you get exactly what you pay for, they are cheap. This means they are very hard to open, especially in the winter. They are not bio-degradable. I saw another review for another bag where the poster stated that is us up to us as consumers to speak with our money. If we do not buy cheap shtty bags like these, then bio-degradable ones will become cheaper. Market forces! So i say why buy these cheap bags that will hold your dog's poop for 200 years? Serenity Now vs Insanity Later? Good luck with your purchase(s) and your pup(s).
customer_reviews.author: M

customer_reviews.title: Flawed product, bags not usable
customer_reviews.text: I seem to have gotten a bad batch and extremely disappointed that I now have to throw out the whole box... the bags are either sealed shut and there is no opening... orrrr there is an opening at both ends. I’m sad for the money we wasted.
customer_reviews.author: Fredie

customer_reviews.title: Rips apart at the seams. Quality control sucks.
customer_reviews.text: Was a good price, especially with Subscribe & Save. But every other roll I’ve been using has been falling apart and ripping at the seams. ANNOYING when I’m out with my dog and can’t safely contain her poop. I must’ve got a bad batch, but I think I’ll stick to Gorilla Supply brand from here on out. I do like that it has an arrow that says OPEN HERE. I don’t like that it has a plastic roll in the center, seems bad for the environment.
customer_reviews.author: Jango Snow

customer_reviews.title: Bags do not separate easily and are difficult to use - NOT recommended
customer_reviews.text: Bags do not separate easily and are difficult to use. We have two dogs who are sometimes difficult on a leash and when holding two dogs and fighting with the roll of bags to separate, I usually give up and use other bags that are easier to deal with. These Amazon Basics bags are the right price but I will not buy them again. In fact, I may donate the ones on hand as the bags do not separate easily by the perforations and the perforations are difficult to see. Hubby says "you get what you pay for" and I usually agree but I did not think that mattered with poop bags - but it does!
customer_reviews.author: Mrs. Virginia A. Butterfield

customer_reviews.title: Dispenser is really cheap and comes apart all the time.
customer_reviews.text: The bags are decent. However the dispenser is very poorly designed. The top will pop off for just no reason a lot. This isn't a matter of me having a defective product - it's clearly poorly designed. The threading for the top is too shallow for the type of plastic material that it's made out of, and so it will just fall off unless you tape it down. It's especially annoying when it comes apart because when the waste bags fall out, they tend to completely unravel, making it a real pain to put it all back together. Such a shame... this could have been so convenient otherwise.
customer_reviews.author: paul otten

customer_reviews.title: Reliable, strong, easy to rip bags. Invest in these !
customer_reviews.text: This is my second box. Lol i didnt think i’d get through the first box so quickly, i didnt think my dog pooped that much. BUT it made me realize, if i spent $1 for 4 rolls at the dollar store; i’d be wasting sooo much money. Thank you Amazon for existing 🥺 No problems, the bags rip easily to the perforated slits, there is no bad smell or anything of that sort. Plastic is strong enough to even hold twigs that you might scoop up along the way, and wont rip through! I even use it to for my phone when i go to the dog beach ! I trust these things with my phone life. Very reliable !
customer_reviews.author: Ariel Almond

customer_reviews.title: Great dog poop bags!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to pick up dog poop on our walks and so far they have worked great!! They are easy to tear off and I love the carrying container. They give you enough room to pick up a 60lb husky poop and to tie off the bag. So far we haven’t had any rip/get holes on us which is great!! They help hide the smell of the dog poop so we don’t smell it on the rest of the walk which is a great bonus. Overall, we are very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: JandD

customer_reviews.title: Heavily perfume scent
customer_reviews.text: These are NOT unscented. They have a heavy perfume smell.
customer_reviews.author: NMG5150

customer_reviews.title: each roll is a surprise
customer_reviews.text: every other roll there are "bags" that just don't "open". It's as if they are a brain teaser as you're standing outside in the rain or cold. Clear flaws in manufacturing.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: No real savings here.
customer_reviews.text: This was my second order of these bags, 600 count, black. About every 3rd bag is defective. they split vertically along a fold line from the opening towards the bottom seam. I've learned that if I gently, gently unfold them before gently, gently opening them before putting my hand into the fully opened bag they may refrain from splitting, or not. My first order was okay, I know there were a few in that order, as in this order, that opened on the bottom seam. I ordered these a month ago, so I wouldn't run out, but I ran out of return time. I do like that these don't have cute slogans or illustrations to sugar-coat their purpose.
customer_reviews.author: Glenn

customer_reviews.title: Cheap, Effective, but your hand will smell
customer_reviews.text: So, I thought maybe it was just the first batch, but bought a second batch since the price is very competitive and same results..... These are very thin bags. They don't tear easily, but DO tear. If you live in a city and your dog sometimes decides to poop on concrete, you need to be VERY VERY careful picking up the poop or your bag will tear. Also, despite trying to crumple as much bag when picking up poop, your hand will smell after. I've tried double bagging it and it doesn't help. Smell goes straight through and you might as well have not used a bag to pick up the poop.
customer_reviews.author: Jimmy B

customer_reviews.title: Cheap and thin bags. Smell strange.
customer_reviews.text: These are very cheap waste bags. They do not dispense easily, which I give partial credit to the actual dispenser, but the bags themselves are cheap and if you push too hard your finger will go through them. They are scentless, but they smell like factory which in the end, it’s better to get scented. The only positive is it does come with a lot of bags which for this price is pretty good. Otherwise, for a bit more money you can get natural disposing bags that are thicker and smell better. I do not recommend, unfortunately.
customer_reviews.author: Devin

customer_reviews.title: Won’t buy again but I’ll use them all
customer_reviews.text: Thick bags, hard to get apart, no scent- they don’t cover the smell at all, and dispenser lasted 30 seconds before it broke off. Nothing to get excited about.
customer_reviews.author: Ellie Sanchez

customer_reviews.title: Short bags
customer_reviews.text: Not great, not terrible. Could be longer. If you have big hands and a lot of poo, this could be a bad situation. I have a small dog, whom takes small doggie doo doos. So idk, just a preference I suppose. I do like that they are black & unscented! Also, be careful when tearing these. Even with the perforations, I found that if I struggled and tore too much, I would accidentally rip the bottom of the bag...so just be gentle with them. All in all, these are a good value & arrived quickly. Its also convenient having the bag holder keychain. Would reccomend in a pinch
customer_reviews.author: Craftgeekmom

customer_reviews.title: Good bags, definitely NOT unscented though
customer_reviews.text: Good value and do the job with no leaks or smells once you tie them shut. Not sure why they're touted as being unscented though, because the definitely have a perfume scent to them. Not bad or overly strong, so we don't mind it, but if you prefer unscented, then keep looking. We have a small dog, but these bags are plenty big for a larger load. Make sure you get them open and ready before you start your walk, because it's a pain trying to open them when you're in the field.
customer_reviews.author: ebuyer

customer_reviews.title: I HATE these - terrible
customer_reviews.text: They're hard to tear and hard to see the perforations. But the WORST part is that they do not hold odor - so you can't just put them in the trash, you have to double bag them in another (different kind of) plastic bag. Don't think you can just use another one of these bags to double bag - the smell comes right through the plastic! If you try throwing these in your trash without using a different kind of plastic bag to double bag, your trash can will smell like you just threw the poop in without any bag at all.
customer_reviews.author: Dan Gralick

customer_reviews.title: bags are open on both ends!!
customer_reviews.text: Bags are not cut properly. Just opened the first roll and you can't open one and the next one is opened on both ends. I hope this improves because there are alot of rolls to go
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Tearing bags off roll is a real struggle and beware of the bag with the open bottom!
customer_reviews.text: They are cheap and you can open the bags without having to wet your fingers (eww) BUT tearing these things off the roll is a real struggle. They really need to fix this. BTW I got one bag so far that wasn’t sealed at the bottom and that was a real disgusting experience, but it was just one bag - so far. Update: Trying to detach these bags from the roll has gotten to be such a struggle that I’m going to toss them and try another brand. Guess you get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: JEC

customer_reviews.title: Best bags for the price!
customer_reviews.text: We have two big dogs, and we live in a townhouse, so we're always picking up after them. We have tried different bags, and all of them pretty much work with no complaints, but for how many bags you get with this order, there is really no comparison. We have been getting them for a couple years, and we have rarely had a problem! We may have had 4-5 bags rip on us since we started using these specific bags, but we have rebought, I want to say three times, so 4-5 out of 2700, I will absolutely take that! They literally last us forever, we probably purchase these only every 6-8 months, so for only $15.00, I definitely recommend!!
customer_reviews.author: Claire

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy
customer_reviews.text: Thin and that piece of tape holding the roll together rips the bag every time. Sometimes just tearing the bag on the perforated line rips the bag. Instead but these. They never rip. Originalpetbags 120 Easy Open & Strong Leak-Proof Poop Bags Dog Waste Bags 13.25 x 9" Made in USA with Dispenser.Bags are easier to tie than standard 12 inch bags
customer_reviews.author: Greg J

customer_reviews.title: Nursery bags and doggy bags
customer_reviews.text: I bought these because you get a lot of bags for your buck. I use these for my dogs poop and in my nursery, for my baby diapers. I find them easy to dispense and sturdy even sturdier then some other fancier doggy bags brand. They are also large enough to easily shove 1-2 loaded diapers in there. Dims are 13inx9in. They also keep the odor in better comparing to other brands I purchased before. Don’t be fooled, they don’t keep it ALL in LOL I will certainly continue buying.
customer_reviews.author: La Vida Loca

customer_reviews.title: Good Bags
customer_reviews.text: Never thought I would write a review on poop bags but here I am. I bought these because they were a daily deal and were well priced. I am shocked by the quality. Over the years I've had the yuck factor while cleaning up after my pup especially in the grass. I have punched through other bags with my nails and well yuck. These I have never done this. Plus my husband who would always use a paper towel to pick up because of the possible yuck factor now just goes for it with these.
customer_reviews.author: Purple

customer_reviews.title: They do the job.
customer_reviews.text: They work, but there are only 15 bags per roll versus 20 on other rolls, so one ends up using more rolls. They are strong, sometimes they're hard to tear apart and get open. They work just fine, and do the job they were meant to do. Just kinda surprised that there weren't more on the roll. At ~2-3 cents per bag they are a little more then others. But they are "Enhanced", (my dog doesn't care much about that though.) They have no scent (thank goodness) there is nothing worse than dog poo and lavender coming at you out of a trash can.
customer_reviews.author: Que

customer_reviews.title: A disgrace - DO NOT BUY
customer_reviews.text: These bags never come well perforated which makes them useless. Try wetting your fingers and it's impossible to get them open. Why I've ordered these time and time again with the same frustration is because Amazon induces you to buy it with a refill order. These are disgraceful and nothing's worsethan having to pick up your dog's waste while trying to wrap unopened bags to get the job done - and inevitably, your hands touch the poop which is gross. DO NOT BUY THESE!
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: My new go-to dog dookie bags
customer_reviews.text: Dog dookie bags, their only purpose is to pick up your pet's waste and then dispose of never to be seen again. I've used my fair share of dog bags (Earth Rated, Gorilla, etc.) and I think these Amazon Basics bags are the best value. I've used a couple of rolls so far and to satisfactory result. No ripping, sturdy, black in color to hide its unmentionable contents and it comes with an extra dispenser! These are scentless, which is fine. I don't see the point of pricier lavender scented bags, it's not like it will hide the stink! If I buy this enough, I'll have a dispenser for each of the dog leash we own. So far, so good.
customer_reviews.author: justChillTop Contributor: Cooking

customer_reviews.title: Too thin, smell gets through, and pre-shredded?
customer_reviews.text: These bags are Very thin-you can really feel the "load" you are picking up. And if you have to carry these for a few minutes on your walk with Rover, while they are "loaded" they can reek. Besides that, towards the end of the first roll, some of the bags have slices in them, your fingers can go right through. Unfortunately I waited a few days too long to return them, if I even could since I already got through one roll. But I won't use them, I switched to some other green bags that are scented.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas W. Clyne

customer_reviews.title: Solid mid-range poop bags
customer_reviews.text: Never had one split, they are about as easy/difficult to open as every dog bag, the material is thin but not so thin it becomes gross, the price is perfect. Not sure what people are expecting in a dog poop bag. I've had really nice thick plastic poop bags before, but I save those mostly for hiking when I'll have to carry the bag for while. These are sturdy enough for everyday use. I even toss toss them over the fence onto the cement driveway and have never had one break.
customer_reviews.author: DrowsyKitten

customer_reviews.title: An uncharacteristically disappointing AmazonBasics item.
customer_reviews.text: I am a fan of AmazonBasics products. I recently bought these bags instead of the brand I usually purchase on Amazon. I immediately noticed that some of the bags were difficult to separate, so I just applied a little extra effort. However, the last roll of bags required that I stand on one end of the bag and pull very hard with two hands to separate the bags. It was almost comical, but I like a challnge. There clearly seems to have been a manufacturing problem with this shipment. I will work my way through this shipment. I'm still a fan of AmazonBasics products but not sure if I will be buying the AmazonBasics brand of dog waste bags again.
customer_reviews.author: White Rabbit

customer_reviews.title: Great bags!
customer_reviews.text: I have been a dog walker for 9 years and have tried out many bags. I also have dogs and chickens at home that I frequently use dog bags for. These are perfect! They are medium to heavy in weight, do not tear, you can't see through them and the scent is subtle, not overpowering but also completely blocks the stinky poo inside when tied. I'm not sure I would recommend for extra large dogs (Great Dane, etc.), the ones with a handle seem best for them. This is a great value. I will be purchasing again!
customer_reviews.author: Heidi M

customer_reviews.title: Perforation Suck, Cardboard Core, but at least Sturdy Bags
customer_reviews.text: I like the thickness/ sturdiness of these bags. No mess gets through. Scent isn't a huge win for me. However, the perforation absolutely sucks. It takes me about 5x longer to rip off a bag from the roll than the previous ones we bought. I also need to start from one side and tear the perforation methodically. The previous ones we bought I could just hold the roll and pull the unrolled end bag to break the perforation. For those environmentally conscious, there is a cardboard core in the center. As for the clip, there is no hook for used bags, so we recycled this clip and kept the one from ~5 bag orders ago that does.
customer_reviews.author: Meg & Brian

customer_reviews.title: Durable, cheap and easy
customer_reviews.text: 22 October 2020 Never thought I would be writing a review on poo bags. Yet, here we are. These bags are amazing. Super easy to tear off, durable and easy to refill. I really like the added white line so I know just where to tear. The painted on arrows makes it easy to know what side to open. So far I have had no rips or tears in any of my uses, and in some cases I am picking up bark/ wood chips with sharp edges and they have not pierced through the bags. Very happy with everything about these and will definitely order again.
customer_reviews.author: -T

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy them
customer_reviews.text: These bags are garbage you pick up poop in the bag and then turn the bag inside out and you have poop on your hands they break easily lol
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Similar to others
customer_reviews.text: This is similar to other products on the market, also fits other dispensers you may have purchased. It is convenient to have these attached in quantities to your leash. One downside is, I think because of environmental awareness, the bag is thin and the odor leaks even if you tie it tightly. We keep throwing these into a separate bin and it smells terrible.
customer_reviews.author: Yavuz

customer_reviews.title: Rips on the sides
customer_reviews.text: I have always been happy with these bags. Until now. A month or so ago I was separating the bags from the roll, I do an entire roll or two at time. That particular bag had at least a 1/2 of dozen bags that had rips on the side of them. It really didn't concern me much at the time, until today. 15 bags from one roll has rips along the side. Sort of difficult to pick up poop with what is basically a flat piece of plastic. Into the garbage they went. I will wait and see what happens with the next bunch. I might have to start shopping for a new brand.
customer_reviews.author: mary s.

customer_reviews.title: Just As Ordered
customer_reviews.text: I've always bought bags from Wal-Mart in multipacks but we run through them rather quickly. These however are a much larger pack for a superior price. On average for our Weimeraner we go through probably 3 bags a day minimum. When we run out of dog bags we use the bags you get from the grocery store. But our supply dwindles very quickly and those bags are way bigger than we need. We also have a bag ban going into effect next year in our state, so keeping dog bags on hand is very important. This makes a much cheaper option, and buying in bulk means fewer purchases. I definitely recommend them.
customer_reviews.author: Kay

customer_reviews.title: Definitely Scented now
customer_reviews.text: You need to update the description to indicate they ARE scented now. I would not have purchased them if I had known since I am definitely very sensitive to scents. Now I have to try and return these and order unscented ones, not sure what the return policy is for partially used products.
customer_reviews.author: James Yee

customer_reviews.title: Works Exactly As A Bag Is Intended
customer_reviews.text: Wow! That’s a lot of bags, makes you wonder if the supply of bags will outlast my pet. Onward... Pros: Lovely black color. Easy to remove a single bag to have at the ready. Bottom seal is secure and won’t split open unexpectedly. Thin enough to not spoil that warm slippery feeling you get when picking up a load. Yes, I’m joking with this one. As good as any other bag for this purpose. Comes with a spiffy color-coordinated carry case for bag rolls. Cons: Does not come with someone to walk the dog for me. Well, nothing is ever perfect. All in all, a good purchase. Lots of sturdy bags and that’s the point.
customer_reviews.author: Thorne HamstringTop Contributor: Cooking

customer_reviews.title: Mostly good but split seams and double bags
customer_reviews.text: On occasion one pulls a bag and the seam is already split. Useless.. Now we're getting bags that were never sealed at the bottom and there are no perforations so you get a double bag. This is maybe useful for vets checking the pregnancy of a horse or for those with dogs as big as a house but really? Most are fine though as long as you don't handle them roughly. Nothing more gross than to tie off a bag and have it split, allowing the contents to alter the look & odor of your hand.
customer_reviews.author: Deloid

customer_reviews.title: These make an unpleasant job easier
customer_reviews.text: I was using doubled plastic grocery bags but was running out of them so decided to buy these. They fit the job perfectly, without doubling them. I have two large dogs (standard poodles) and one medium dog and one small dog. The bags are more than adequate for even the largest dogs I have. I make a knot at the top and throw them in trash container; none have broken open. Don't know if they contain the odor over the time between trash pick-ups, but since container is outside that is not a concern. Will buy again when needed.
customer_reviews.author: SanLynn 36

customer_reviews.title: Could be a Little Bigger!
customer_reviews.text: The only comparison experience I have is with typical grocery bags along with using a product that you attach a bag to to pick up the after math. Not sure how well they work using straight up and I NEVER will! But based off of my personal experience using them, I feel they could be a smidge larger. Other than that though, they seem to do a pretty good job concealing what it contains with out issue. I do intend to keep purchasing these in the future. Feel like it's a fair price and definitely working for me better than a typical grocery bag did.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua

customer_reviews.title: Too Difficult to Tear
customer_reviews.text: These bags are the same size and quality of the Earth-Rated brand I usually use. With a lower price point I thought it would be worth giving them a try. HOWEVER, the perforations are not nearly enough to allow for easy tearing. In fact, I feel as if I have to fight with the roll just to tear off a bag. I will not be purchasing this brand again.
customer_reviews.author: S.ViV

customer_reviews.title: Strong, Reliable, and Easy to Dispense
customer_reviews.text: These bags are fantastic! Unlike other brands, I have yet to pull out a bag that has a hole in the bottom. The perforations are perfect and tear easily and cleanly each time. There is a light scent to the bags that is neither overwhelming nor does it transfer to my hands. They tie up nicely, and they hold a good deal of poo. Once inside the bag, you don't smell the hidden product. Definitely a great purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Jeannie M. Bushnell

customer_reviews.title: PICK UP AFTER YOUR DOGS PEOPLE
customer_reviews.text: Every dog owner should pickup after their dog. And for less than $20 you get 900 sheets, there is literally no excuse. The bags are sturdier than most of the waste I've used. Although, quality is hit or miss sometimes. after going through about 1200 of these, I've had two different occasion where the seal wasn't complete and grabbed more than what I wanted. I'm knocking it down a star for that. Still very good value for what you're getting, and they ship you the container so you won't have to carry one at a time and use some lame excuse to not pick up when your puppy goes #2 for the 3rd time on the walk
customer_reviews.author: PK

customer_reviews.title: No way they're making money on this
customer_reviews.text: This is 600 baggies for like $12. I bought this for my dog August 15, 2018. It is now March 23, 2020. I still have over half the box left of baggies. This box will probably out last the dog. Of course my dog doesn't poop very much, but still. The baggies aren't anything special, but why should they be if you're just going to pick up poop with them. Once they're tied up and closed, zero poop stench gets out. Fairly sturdy. I sometimes throw the baggies at the trash can and, of course, occasionally miss, and none of yet to tear or burst open.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good, simple, reliable product.
customer_reviews.text: These are great bags, not ridiculously thick, but just thick enough to make you notice and appreciate the difference when compared to the cheapo bags. Your hands won't get that annoying poo smell on them like they often do with the paper thin bags. And quite frankly, at this price, these outshine those cheapo bags in value anyway. The bag holder that comes with this is nice, but after ordering enough of these, they start to become unnecessary - they are durable enough to last for many years, so you just end up stockpiling them. It would be nice if there was an option to order without the holder and save a buck.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good poop bags!! Good for diapers too!
customer_reviews.text: This is the second large box of Amazon bags that I've purchased. I haven't had any issues at all. I generally throw the bags into our outdoor trash can, but sometimes bring them into the kitchen trash can. Either way, we have had zero issues with stinky cans!! We are out of diaper stage in our family, but I've recommended to a few friends with babies to keep these in their diaper bag and home. If I was doing diapers again, I would use these rather than the diaper genie!!
customer_reviews.author: LG

customer_reviews.title: Thicker Mils and Good-Sized; Solid.
customer_reviews.text: We've been using these bags for a few years now and will continue. The bags are a thicker mil than some competitor's and are generously-sized. I don't recall there ever having been a defective roll in the bunch (i.e. bottom seam not fully sealed, or cut bags). Roll holder and leash clip work as intended, although do not over-tighten the cap to the holder as it may cause the cap to split, or may "strip" the cap screws so it loosens easily and may unintentionally fall off. You may scent them as you desire.
customer_reviews.author: Anisoptera

customer_reviews.title: Must have if you have lots of poop to scoop
customer_reviews.text: As a dog walker walking up to 12 dogs at once for 2 hours plus I own 5 dogs, GOOD quality poop bags are a must have. I have tried other brands off amazon, sooooooo disappointed. SO thin, test easily, so easy that my finger would go through the bag, bags would burst at the seam when full 😐 bad alllll bad. These? FANTASTIC! People get a good laugh out of them saying AMAZON on the bag too. Brilliant. I prefer this white dispenser over the standard bone too. Smaller but still holds the big rolls 👌🏻👍🏻
customer_reviews.author: CanineCrazy

customer_reviews.title: Very convenient and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I have the dog waste bag dispenser attached to my leash handle. It has been very handy instead of having to maintain and carry small plastic grocery bags. I live in an area where I need to wear gloves during the winter. I have been able to pull a waste bag from the dispenser and open it with my gloves on with no problem. I have yet to have a problem with any tears or leaks. The bags are solid. The only thing I have had to careful doing is removing the small white tape when installing a new roll of bags in the dispenser so that I don't rip the first bag down the middle.
customer_reviews.author: David S

customer_reviews.title: Makes picking up after my dog does his business so much easier!
customer_reviews.text: Although the park where I walk my dog provides poop bags, sometimes the dispensers are empty or the bags are difficult to get off the roll. I decided to get some of my own and chose these because they came in a compact dispenser that was light weight. Not only are these poop bags strong and odorless, they are a cinch to remove from their dispenser. Replacing the empty roll of bags takes 30 seconds at most and the clip that attaches to the dog’s leash is sturdy. I could not be more pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Gaye Levy

customer_reviews.title: Affordable durable dog poop bags
customer_reviews.text: Great for quantity and price. Not as thin as some cheap bags and I'm very satisfied with them. The included dispenser doesn't provide much resistance so sometimes you have to hold the roll when you want to tear off a bag but that's just an issue with the cheap dispenser they include and not the bags themselves. I just put these bags in other dispensers I like more, but if those run out and I need a bag before I refill the dispenser, I just grab out out of the included dispenser and it works well enough.
customer_reviews.author: CB

customer_reviews.title: Who reviews poop bags?
customer_reviews.text: I do. I wasn't going to, because they're poop bags, and they're all the same thing. But I've been using these for a year now, and we just ran out. I wasn't concerned, bags are bags. Except these bags are ridiculously good. They do not let the smell escape. I have been using grocery bags for two days, and used dollar store bags before that, and I'm placing an order right now. These bags are thick and durable, and really handle odor control. Plus they're inexpensive!
customer_reviews.author: Missy

customer_reviews.title: The best!
customer_reviews.text: We are on our second box now... they're easy to tear, no stinky fragrance, and opaque (no seeing smeared doggie doo! - gross!) Also - the dispenser is very nice. My kids tend to be hard on these - so they usually crack open and the roll goes everywhere - these do not, and the opening is substantial so it's easy to load. The only thing we do is take off the loop that holds the dispenser to the leash - we replace them with a zip-tie and they're awesome! Highly recommend - great value!!!
customer_reviews.author: Estarr1218

customer_reviews.title: They Do Their Duty
customer_reviews.text: For the most part, they're fine. They're plastic bags for picking up dog poop. My only minor issue is that sometimes they're really difficult to tear apart at the seems (I have to really yank on them to pull them apart). They're thin, but not too thin. Unlike the bags I bought at Petsmart, those would tear holes in them easily and a minimum of one bag per roll would split down ther side and be unusable. So these are much better than that. I've used like 10 rolls so far and had no holes or split bags.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: Great for Picking up Other Peoples Dog Poop!
customer_reviews.text: I was so happy how this product was perfect for picking up my to little dogs poops in our yard. But I had no Idea how amazing it is at picking up Other Peoples Dog Poopies. These are so phenomenal I have put them outside our house to let others try this amazing product. It is so sad I can not get others to enjoy the simple pleasure of picking up after their own little furry family member. I assure you , my boys leave small presents, but I know for a fact I can pick up Great Dane or Pit Bull Poop with these amazing bags. Please, Please EVERY DOG OWNER needs these bags.
customer_reviews.author: privatperson

customer_reviews.title: a dog walker's essential.
customer_reviews.text: so i do part-time dog walking and when i first started i noticed that some of these dog owners also did something part time- being a responsible pet owner *cringe*, and didn't have or provide doggy bags. i quickly prime-d myself these and they have come in handy far more than they should have. if i could invoice the owners for their irresponsibility i would, but instead i just passive aggressively mention i took care of it in the comments. one star taken away for adding more unnecessary plastic waste into the landfills... biodegradable bags would be a much appreciated addition.
customer_reviews.author: onlinej

customer_reviews.title: Will buy again
customer_reviews.text: I know there's not much to be said about poop bags. Either they work, or they don't. These work just fine, and cost a fraction of the price that we'd been paying for the 'Nature's Miracle' brand ones we had been using for the past 4 months. Comparing them to the NM brand? These are a whopping 1/2" shorter and 3/16" less wide. Negligible on both counts. Have yet to have a problem with them tearing or not coming off the roll properly. Maybe we've been lucky thus far, but I doubt it. I'm including a picture to give a reference point of comparison between these poop bags and a standard piece of printer paper. Hope it helps.
customer_reviews.author: dBdraggin

customer_reviews.title: W-a-l-k e w-a-l-k time
customer_reviews.text: Unscented, most sturdy, & opaque - great qualities. Only had a couple that split at seems, out of a whole box - not ideal, but out of the number in a box - that’s subjective decision whether or not to pursue. Just need to figure out the best way to close in winter, so as not to fuss with gloves, leashes, etc. and stay clean & not freeze fingers off. I have two Great Pyrenees - the bag is big enough most of the time for one pile at a time. I don’t use the dispenser, but open and prep the bags prior to w-a-l-k time. They now know that the sound of fiddling with the bags means.
customer_reviews.author: George

customer_reviews.title: Baggies break open
customer_reviews.text: Bags blow out at seams easily. We scoop our cat box at night and drop the full baggie outside our front door to be disposed of in the morning. Dropping them even gently causes the bag to break open. Been doing this forever with multiple other bags and no problems. Too bad I’ve now got hundreds of these :(
customer_reviews.author: Falcon1

customer_reviews.title: Unscented and not too thin
customer_reviews.text: I really hate the idea of using a special plastic bag to clean up after a dog. It seems as about as environmentally friendly as styrofoam plates. But, some things just don’t have a good alternative (at least as far as I know). These are unscented and not too thin. The bags have an arrow printed on the bag to let you know which end opens, which is nice. The box also came with a bag dispenser that you can clip on the leash. All in all this is a great deal.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Great Purchase & Easy Open Bags
customer_reviews.text: I am on my second roll of these waste bags. During the COVID-19 pandemic, the dog and I went on many walks. 75% of the time, he had a bowel movement that needed to be picked up, according to our city ordinances, as well as for being a responsible pet owner. I HAVE ALWAYS cleaned up after my pets. The dispenser is hooked to hes retractable leash handle. So it makes grabbing a bag very convenient. I am certain these bags may last me as long as six months or more. I know from purchasing 8-12 rolls from the store could cost as much 8-12 dollars. I thought this was great deal and a wonderful purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Michael B.

customer_reviews.title: Good to buy in bulk!
customer_reviews.text: These are a decent price for the amount you get, plus dispenser. There is a slight scent to them, it doesn't really make its contents any less offensive, however its like a scented distraction. The bags are thin, and as long as you don't get too rough with them or poke them, your hands will be safe from the poop. Black is great so people can't see what is going on inside the bags... even though we all know what is in it! I would get these again.
customer_reviews.author: Greener

customer_reviews.title: First batch I bought was fine - second time the quality has noticeably dropped
customer_reviews.text: The first batch of these bags I bought were perfect but now when you separate a bag from the roll to use - it causes the next bag to get slices down the sides of the next bag. The slices don't keep you from being able to pick up poop but now you have to use a second bag to keep your hands from getting covered in poop. I'm disappointed because Amazon's stuff is usually good quality. Having to use 2 bags for each poop also doesn't make the pricing a good deal any more.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Cheap dog poop bags.
customer_reviews.text: It was saying unscented but it’s not true. It has a weird scent. Some of them rips easily. It’s just like the price- cheap.
customer_reviews.author: Simbel Ayse

customer_reviews.title: Good bag. Biodegradable. A little hard to tear from the roll.
customer_reviews.text: I walk to dog after dark. I have difficulty tearing one bag off using one of those clip-on dispensers that attach to a lead. I usually end up pulling too many bags out. I wish they tore more easily separating the dispensed bag from the roll. (My wife says she has no trouble, but during daylight it's easier to see the score line where to tear and she's not juggling the lead, a flashlight, umbrella, whatever.) The bags are sturdy and big enough to tie a knot to secure the load.
customer_reviews.author: HilltownRoots

customer_reviews.title: Unscented, Sturdy, Awesome
customer_reviews.text: Are you looking for a set of unscented dog poop bags? Do you want something that’ll hold up to heavy poop and your attempts to toss it in the park’s garage can like a basketball star (knowing you’ll likely miss, but the bag won’t rip open)? Then look no further, my friend. We took a chance on these after our trusty OUT bags started arriving scented like dollar store perfume, so much so that it embarassed the pup, and these fit the bill perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Kaylan

customer_reviews.title: A ton of large bags!
customer_reviews.text: These bags are large and sturdy. I have a golden retriever and I can manage to pick up 5 of her poops in one of these bags (doing a cleanup sweep of the yard). It could probably hold more, but is limited to my hand capacity when picking them up. Usually I prefer the bags with handles, but that's just so that I have some extra space to tie with. While these don't have handles, there is plenty of room to tie them. In fact, I actually feel wasteful when I use these on a walk and only pickup 1 poop in them.
customer_reviews.author: AU

customer_reviews.title: Undisclosed fragrance in product
customer_reviews.text: This item is fragranced! The listing does not disclose that the item is fragranced at all. This is a serious health issue that could really hurt someone who has mcs. I’m already disgusted that I have to constantly be checking every item I buy for fragrance now, but if it’s not labeled as containing fragrance it impossible. These chemicals are toxic and harmful to everyone even if they don’t get immediately sick like me. Its poo! It smells bad! Do we really need to embed poo bags with toxic chemicals for the one second it takes to pick up a poo?
customer_reviews.author: perche

customer_reviews.title: MADE IN CHINA
customer_reviews.text: I have bought these poop bags several times in the past without considering where they made.....until today! The box arrived with Chinese writing all over the label and said, "Made in China." Although the bags are of good quality, I unfortunately will never buy them again because they are made in China. I mean come on, we can't even manufacture something as simple as a dog poop bag here in the good ole U.S.A.?!?!?!? Sad and very disappointing indeed. Read the labels people! Support America; BUY AMERICAN!
customer_reviews.author: tdf55

customer_reviews.title: Great for humans too!
customer_reviews.text: Works great for humans too! Use to discard sanitary napkins and non flushable wipes. Will save money 💰 on Toilet paper 🧻. Daughter wont need to make a cocoon for each pad! Everyone in the house can use! Trash is more tidy and odor is better controlled. No csi crime scene in the trash! Husband is happy! Lol! Goes well in both my white, black and gray bothrooms! We dont even have a dog!
customer_reviews.author: Tracy Patterson

customer_reviews.title: Have used close to 1000 of these with no holes
customer_reviews.text: Why spend twice as much on poop bags, when these are just as high quality? I've used close to 1000 of these bags over the course of a year+ and not once have I had a bag with a defect (tear, hole, etc.). The bags feel quality and not too thin. They do a good job locking in the smell when tied up. The included dispenser is nice, and the bags are easy to load and remove from the holder. If you have a giant breed dog who takes massive poops, these bags may be too small for your needs. They aren't the widest. Other than that, I have nothing bad to say about this product. A+
customer_reviews.author: Wesley Danger

customer_reviews.title: this is a great product, at a very nice price
customer_reviews.text: this is a great product, at a very nice price. These bags are slightly larger and thicker than the ones that are sold in grocery and pet food stores. And you get 800 of them for less than $15! The nicest feature though, is that there is printing on the bags that clearly indicate which end opens (with a little arrow) and at the bottom of each bag, there's a small printed white rectangle. Might not sound like a big deal, but this is extremely helpful when you're out in the rain/snow/wind/whatever, trying to clean up after your pet in public. We'll definitely purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: Too many defective bags
customer_reviews.text: I have been buying these bags for years but lately there have been too many defective bags in each roll. Where you pull the bags apart at the perforation the bags get a hole. I have had this happen with each group at least 2 to 3 bags in each roll. I am going to look into other brands.
customer_reviews.author: Ali

customer_reviews.title: Difficult to open
customer_reviews.text: Sometimes these bags are extremely difficult to open and after fumbling with one for a few minutes I'll give up and just use it unopened to pick up what needs to be removed from the sidewalk. It would be nice if they make a plastic bag that was easy to open.
customer_reviews.author: ScottW

customer_reviews.title: Rip easily, so use caution
customer_reviews.text: This is the second time I bought these bags. The first time (I believe sometime in 2018) - I loved them. They were so easy to dispense and incredibly sturdy. When I reordered them earlier this year, I could tell they somehow changed them. The bags are significantly thinner, are very difficult to separate/pull apart from the dispenser, and very often rip at the worst possible moment, if you get my drift. I think they’re still good for the money, but be very careful while using them.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole Hurchick

customer_reviews.title: Bag Holder Quality Has Dropped to Useless
customer_reviews.text: Wow! I’ve been using these dog bags for some time. The bags themselves are good quality, especially the strength and the fact that they are unscented. The bag holder is suddenly so cheaply made I can’t believe it’s being sold. The plastic holder in the newest box cracked the first day and had to be discarded. I opted to switch it out with my daughter’s recently purchased one. This bag holder is just as bad. It won’t stay together just go down the street without opening and dropping its contents. Without a useable bag holder I guess I’ll have to go back to the brand I used before I discovered these. Very disappointing... :(
customer_reviews.author: M. O.

customer_reviews.title: Decent quality; good price
customer_reviews.text: First, all dog owners should be cleaning up after their dogs outside of their property (I'd recommend cleaning up in your own property as well if possible). The material is pretty durable, which is a relief since I was afraid it would be super thin. I can't really say much more. They're plastic poopie bags, not quantum processors. Note: Out of about 60-80 that I have used, 1 bag did open up at the bottom.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good size for smaller dogs, not so much for larger dogs!
customer_reviews.text: These bags are OK if you have a small dog whose big jobs are actually small jobs! My dog weighs 110 lbs. These bags need to be 2” longer to be able to accommodate picking up his poopers and allow tying a knot so I can carry to nearest bin. On the plus side, they don’t let odors escape and they tear off the roll very easily. Amazon was very helpful with my stinky issues and I donated the bags to my nearest shelter. They were pleased to get, so that worked out nicely for all! Thanks Amazon!
customer_reviews.author: Terry Gray

customer_reviews.title: Are negative reviews getting different bags?
customer_reviews.text: I can't speak for the dispenser as we don't use them but I find these bags to be very sturdy, black black (not black and than you scoop the poop and realize how thin the bag is because you can see the poop inside) they hide the evidence. Once I tie it off, smell is contained and they're poop bags. Don't know what else to say about them but that I do prefer these to various ones I've bought from pet smart that ended up being too thin and easy to tear
customer_reviews.author: Betty Davis

customer_reviews.title: Smelly in the garbage
customer_reviews.text: We have bought these bags a couple times and I think this time they are thinner. When we throw them away in our garbage after pick up the yard the next day the garbage can smells very bad. I have cleaned the garbage can every week for the last 3 weeks but every time we throw dog waste in it stinks. We will be looking for a heftier waste collection bags on our next order. For now we will be double bagging...kind of negating what a good deal these were.
customer_reviews.author: dan zunker

customer_reviews.title: Best poop bags I've ever had
customer_reviews.text: Love these bags. I've gone through many different kinds of poop bags over the last few years and have had many a disappointment. One of the most important things in poop bags for me is the sturdiness. you don't want to pick up after your pup and have the bags rip. These are much thicker than many brands I've tried and come at a much better price! I think I've been using these for about 2 years now and out of well over a 100 rolls there was only a single one that wasn't manufactured right. Definitely recommend these poop bags!
customer_reviews.author: Bonsai

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and easily dispensed
customer_reviews.text: These bags are easily loaded and retrieved from the dispenser, which I have attached to my dogs leash. I've used a half dozen rolls without issue. Some reviews indicate that these are hard to open? I've had issues with other disposal bags, usually due to the other bags being so thin. These are not too thin and very durable. Will re-order again when I run out!!
customer_reviews.author: Mdspurbe

customer_reviews.title: Useless now
customer_reviews.text: I've been using these bags for years and recently re-ordered and in the last few days I've gone through 5 rolls of bags because as soon as I open it and put my hand in it, it breaks. I've also picked up poop and then was tying it and then the bottom breaks and the poop falls out the bottom. It's extremely frustrating!!! And not to mention disgusting. Something has changed with their quality because I didn't have this issue before but I will be finding a new brand as these are horrible now!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: strong and does the job
customer_reviews.text: Use these for my cat, actually. The opening of the bag is big enough to put a smaller-sized scoop in to dump my cat's 'business' into the bag neatly. No issues with quality; they are very strong, just as strong as the other eco-brand I've purchased in the past. I liked the little dispenser that came with it, too. I haven't noticed any bad scent from the bags themselves, and especially not after filling it, as I dispense it into a diaper genie. Strong little bags for a good price.
customer_reviews.author: Sue Z. Q.

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price
customer_reviews.text: The price is fantastic, and it's really nice to not have to worry about buying poop bags for a while. They aren't as long as the ones we previously used, so they did take some getting used to. I would take off half a star because it feels like they don't hold as much as most brands I've used in the past. The quality of the plastic seems better than some brands and on par with others, so I don't really worry about them ripping.
customer_reviews.author: Sassy Scottish Sister

customer_reviews.title: Good bag, but sometimes rip
customer_reviews.text: I have been using these pet waste bags for over a year now (multiple order) and while they are large for my big dogs waste, sometimes the bags are sealed on both sides and cannot be opened without ripping. I don’t know about you but I don’t want a bag ripping when I’m trying to pick up dog poop. Even with that issue, I’ll probably keep ordering them every six months or so, because they are a good price even with some of the bags ripping. They also come with a dispenser for the bags you can use on walks.
customer_reviews.author: Chamaole

customer_reviews.title: A good value
customer_reviews.text: Worth the price. These are good, sturdy bags, come apart easily, do not have a scent, and are a good price. I do recommend these to other dog owners. The best part is they have no scent which I like because the ones with scent are irritating.
customer_reviews.author: Peggy

customer_reviews.title: Failure - gross.
customer_reviews.text: I've gone through 2 big boxes of these and had mixed opinions. Sometimes they are a snap to separate and easy to open. Other timers they are difficult. The worse came last week when the bottom of the bag failed while I was carrying the poop. It got all over me - my clothes, my shoes, my legs. That did it for me, that is the part that needs to be 100% - the bag seal. I'm testing other brands now but can no longer recommend Amazon basic.
customer_reviews.author: Jim in FL

customer_reviews.title: Unscented but heavy enough to block the odor.  Tear resistant.
customer_reviews.text: We have been using these for about three years. We never buy anything else. The bags are fairly thick and I don't remember one ever tearing. They are unscented, but they are thick enough that they block any odor once they are tied closed. They're inexpensive enough that when you see one of "those" dog owners who refuse to pick up after their pets you can hand them a roll and say, "I guess you forgot yours!"
customer_reviews.author: Randy Carey-Walden

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised
customer_reviews.text: Halfway through the first 810 count box (I bought 3 of them). So, far, no holes, no leaks. They don't feel as thick / sturdy as the ones I previously got from PetSmart (at probably 2x the price), but for the short period of time I need them to contain the contents, they seems to work fine. The garbage can definitely smells by the time garbage day rolls around, so I suspect that they are not super sturdy. That being said, I haven't had any "failure to contain" issues in several hundred bags thus far.
customer_reviews.author: Big Al

customer_reviews.title: Opens a lot easier and is more durable
customer_reviews.text: Nothing worse than standing in sub zero temperates, and not being able to open a bag with your gloves off. Well on the same scale...once you open the bag, or tear bag off...it rips and now the waste will touch your hand...so now you need to struggle with anotehr new bag or double up. This nightmare has happened many times with other brands of bags. These bags open more easily and are made of better quality plastic. Having two dogs, even if opened the bag at home first, the other goes..etc., etc. But with these bags, I no longer dread opening or breaking. The size is also better, if you have a larger dog, or two dogs (I do).
customer_reviews.author: DecadentLife

customer_reviews.title: sturdy well designed bags!
customer_reviews.text: Hard to believe I am writing a review about poop bags but when our local store was out I ordered these. They are great because they are sturdy, (they held the poop even when my spouse tossed a filled one towards the trash can), have a little arrow to show the top and a visible line to see where to tear off the next bag. for the price we get almost double than our local big box store. Good show Amazon!
customer_reviews.author: Midwifemama

customer_reviews.title: Perfect bags to be a good neighbor
customer_reviews.text: I've purchased these bags in the past in bulk and it was finally time to restock. The bags are solid and sturdy so no worry when picking up after your pet. I have a little bag dispenser attached to my dogs leash and the bags are really easy to pull and separate from the next bag. The one thing I've noticed compared to some cheaper bags are that these do a good job of minimizing the scent once you tie them up. Cheaper thinner bags seem to smell which is really unpleasant. All in all, a lot of bags at a good price that are durable and sturdy. Can't complain.
customer_reviews.author: Derek L

product_meta.title: AmazonBasics Unscented Standard Dog Poop Bags with Dispenser and Leash Clip, 13 x 9 Inches, Black - Pack of 900
feature_bullets: Includes 900, Black dog poop bags with dispenser and leash clip (15 bags per roll, 60 rolls total)
Polyethylene bags offer reliable strength, keeping hands protected and minimizing odors
Plastic dispenser for easily removing a bag from the roll; carabiner-style clip for attaching dispenser to a leash
Bag Dimensions: Each bag measures 9 by 13 inches (LxW)

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
